name: TheAtlantic
text: In states across the South and West, coronavirus cases are going up, but lockdowns seem less realistic than ever, @russellberman reports: https://t.co/DJkc2pKfNZ

name: TheAtlantic
text: This year’s Juneteenth celebrations are inflected with a renewed sense of urgency. The latest Atlantic Daily, by @mimbsy: https://t.co/uyGwabKdeI

name: TheAtlantic
text:
This year, "Insecure" finally began to make good on its original promise: to meaningfully explore the friendship between two black women, @ethiopienne writes.
 https://t.co/ngTbLYbZSp

name: TheAtlantic
text: "Roberts is a bulwark against Trumpism on the Court, not because he is ideologically hostile to it, but because Roberts expects the federal government to adhere to minimum standards of honesty and fidelity to the public interest," @AdamSerwer writes: https://t.co/tiYRBPLF0y

name: TheAtlantic
text: Yesterday's Arsenal and Manchester City game surfaced an uncomfortable feeling for one fan: ambivalence. James Parker writes: https://t.co/IXaaIOEr8E

name: TheAtlantic
text: "I think people said, 'I’m tired of mourning. Let me do something besides mourn. Let me challenge a country to live up to its stated ideals.'" @SmithsonianSec Lonnie Bunch spoke with @AdamSerwer about this moment in the long arc of history: https://t.co/Y0e05SfNek

name: TheAtlantic
text: I’m no fan of his, but he is doing a service to the nation by speaking out, @thomaswright08 writes: https://t.co/Fjc0nIY7i4

name: TheAtlantic
text: "Has something snapped for good in Roberts? Has he reached some legal or political breaking point?" @davidfrum writes: https://t.co/JYTu67qsSK

name: TheAtlantic
text:
“Although they aren’t fun, bad feelings are supremely important.”

@ArthurBrooks on what we can learn from three groups who are experienced in managing discomfort: athletes, monks, and the elderly. https://t.co/Cq30HXz1tf

name: TheAtlantic
text: In this week’s “How to Build a Life,” @arthurbrooks explains how embracing negative feelings leads to emotional strength, which in turn leads to a good, meaningful life: https://t.co/Qgb0tE3vVJ

name: TheAtlantic
text: The young people fueling today's protest movements will eventually dictate the American political mainstream, @RonBrownstein writes. But just how long will that take? https://t.co/3ciblUKkO6

name: TheAtlantic
text: A collection of images of some of the hundreds of bird species that call Turkey’s Lake Van home. Via @TheAtlPhoto: https://t.co/4KVRCuopOk

name: TheAtlantic
text: "Nearly 700,000 DACA recipients currently in the program need not fear lightning Immigration and Customs Enforcement raids for a while longer," @profepps writes: https://t.co/NkpDQx9JRn

name: TheAtlantic
text: "How do the human beings whom communities hire, train, and supervise," @R_T_Rybak writes, "end up killing people they are supposed to protect and serve?" https://t.co/ESyJ79v1ZT

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @PeterAtlantic: Doctors Fauci and Birx have in the past cautioned Pres. Trump -- who on Saturday will hold his first rally in 3 months -- about the risk of the virus spreading in crowds. https://t.co/W1qM6b53PO

name: TheAtlantic
TheAtlantic
text:
RT @IsaacDovere: .@PeterAtlantic: “Anyone who catches the disease will have sacrificed their health for the televised illusion that Trump is in control, the virus is in retreat, and the country is back to normal, when in fact cases are hitting record highs in OK&elsewhere“
https://t.co/evzVs1lB5J

name: TheAtlantic
text:
RT @YasmeenSerhan: Being a Washington correspondent is among the most prestigious postings available to international journalists. It's never been considered a particularly risky one, either.

I wrote about why that's no longer the case:  
https://t.co/8FkiK9WLFa

name: TheAtlantic
text: Whether companies and state governments acknowledge Juneteenth or not, black-led celebrations will remain the heart of Emancipation Day, @kcarterjackson writes: https://t.co/pN99Ojoh6O

name: TheAtlantic
text: Monuments are coming down and myths are being rewritten, which means it's a perfect time for Bob Dylan's spellbinding new album, @skornhaber writes. https://t.co/o6CFFZVrrN

name: TheAtlantic
text: "When jubilant supporters peel off their masks and whoop their approval as he torches Joe Biden, rest assured that the president will be a safe distance from any pathogens spat into the air," Peter Nicholas writes. "It’s the crowd that’s at the most risk." https://t.co/bIBEZOtwLL

name: TheAtlantic
text:
In his new novel, Kevin Kwan, the author of “Crazy Rich Asians,” takes on New York WASPs. 

“I am not a creative person,” Kwan told Ryan Bradley. “I’m an observer. I just see things, and I soak things up.” https://t.co/I0SBhtghhB
